mods.abstract: Photograph showing three horses pulling a harvester in a field with one man driving the team.
mods.note: Compare photograph to the following publication. Dodson, W.R. (1911, September) Lespedeza or Japan Clover. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 130, p. 26. Photograph is captioned, "Harvesting oats, yielding 42 bushels per acre, with a crop of lespedeza coming on three months later yielding more than one and a half tons of hay." Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://books.google.com/books?id=de42AQAAIAAJ&pg=RA5-PA1&lpg=RA5-PA1&dq=Louisiana+Bulletin+No.+130+1911+Dodson&source=bl&ots=2rOHUxPJUa&sig=n32VJFq6oJR99Jyfmtrvi46E-hY&hl=en&sa=X&ei=ZyrEU7D0AeXo8QGdj4DQDg&ved=0CCUQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=Sherwood&f=false

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
